description.narrative: Building on the experiences of the IFAD-funded Smallholder Agribusiness Promotion Programme (SAPP), the programme will sustainably increase smallholder production, productivity and sales of smallholder farmers in the targeted areas. At the goal level, the Programme is expected to assist up to 48,000 smallholder households (80 per cent of the core target group) to achieve at least one of the following: (i) increase household asset ownership; (ii) increase in household savings; reduction in prevalence of child malnutrition; and (iv) reduction in food insecurity.The programme will support the efforts of the Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives (MACO) to: (i) prioritize its research efforts on priority issues for smallholder farmers in northern Zambia; (ii) strengthen the linkages between agricultural extension and research; (iii) appropriately tailor its approaches for extension; (v) coordinate external donor-financed initiatives, learn from them and integrate positive features into its approach; (v) strengthen its capacity for planning, managing and delivering farmer services; and (vi) develop approaches for promoting, regulating and monitoring service provision by non-government actors.
This point represents the centroid of the project area. For more detailed geographic information, please refer to the project page on the IFAD website.
